'''Gormadoc "Deepdelver" Brandybuck''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Gormadoc was named Deepdelver in his lifetime. He married [[Malva Headstrong]], and had three children: [[Madoc Brandybuck|Madoc]], [[Sadoc Brandybuck|Sadoc]] and [[Marroc Brandybuck|Marroc]].<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

It is possible that during his office he enlarged [[Brandy Hall]].<ref>[[Robert Foster]], ''[[The Complete Guide to Middle-earth]]'', p. 172</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name ''Gormadoc'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref name="Translation">{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref>

[[Jim Allan]] suggests that it contains the element ''gor'', which means "over" in [[Welsh]] as a prefix to [[Madoc Brandybuck|Madoc]],<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 202</ref> the first name of Gormadoc Brandybuck's son.
